intro: Guzmania recurvobracteata, commonly known as the recurved bract guzmania, is a species of flowering plant in the Bromeliaceae family. It is native to the tropical rainforests of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant features striking, long-lasting inflorescences with vibrant red bracts that contrast with its dark green foliage. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires high humidity and well-draining soil. Guzmania recurvobracteata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
